intro: Fadogia tetraquetra var. tetraquetra, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has compound leaves with a trifoliate structure, and its roots are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats.
